meanings.definition: To make (an egg) capable of development by introducing sperm into it.
meanings.sent1: The farmer fertilized the egg to help it grow.
meanings.sent2: The hen's egg was fertilized by the rooster.
meanings.sent3: The egg was so happy to be fertilized and start growing.
meanings.sent4: Her words fertilized the idea, sparking new possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The process of fertilizing the egg is crucial for life to begin.

meanings.definition: To make (soil) more fertile by adding nutrients.
meanings.sent1: The gardener fertilized the soil to help the plants grow.
meanings.sent2: The fields were fertilized with organic compost.
meanings.sent3: The soil felt like a superhero after being fertilized with nutrients.
meanings.sent4: The idea of growth fertilized the barren land, bringing forth new life.
meanings.sent5: Fertilizing the soil is like giving it a nutritious meal to thrive.

meanings.definition: To make (an idea or plan) more likely to succeed by adding new elements or resources.
meanings.sent1: She fertilized her business plan with innovative strategies.
meanings.sent2: The team fertilized the project with fresh perspectives.
meanings.sent3: The idea felt energized after being fertilized with creativity.
meanings.sent4: His determination fertilized the plan, leading to great success.
meanings.sent5: Fertilizing the idea with passion can yield amazing results.
